1.text: My son, do not forget my teaching, but let your heart keep my commandments;

2.text: for they will add length to your days, years and peace to your life.

3.text: Never let loving devotion or faithfulness leave you; bind them around your neck, write them on the tablet of your heart.

4.text: Then you will find favor and high regard in the sight of God and man.

5.text: Trust in the LORD with all your heart, and lean not on your own understanding;

6.text: in all your ways acknowledge Him, and He will make your paths straight.

7.text: Be not wise in your own eyes; fear the LORD and turn away from evil.

8.text: This will bring healing to your body and refreshment to your bones.

9.text: Honor the LORD with your wealth and with the firstfruits of all your crops;

10.text: then your barns will be filled with plenty, and your vats will overflow with new wine.

11.text: My son, do not reject the discipline of the LORD, and do not loathe His rebuke;

12.text: for the LORD disciplines the one He loves, as does a father the son in whom he delights.

13.text: Blessed is the man who finds wisdom, the man who acquires understanding,

14.text: for she is more profitable than silver, and her gain is better than fine gold.

15.text: She is more precious than rubies; nothing you desire compares with her.

16.text: Long life is in her right hand; in her left hand are riches and honor.

17.text: All her ways are pleasant, and all her paths are peaceful.

18.text: She is a tree of life to those who embrace her, and those who lay hold of her are blessed.

19.text: The LORD founded the earth by wisdom and established the heavens by understanding.

20.text: By His knowledge the watery depths were broken open, and the clouds dripped with dew.

21.text: My son, do not lose sight of this: Preserve sound judgment and discernment.

22.text: They will be life to your soul and adornment to your neck.

23.text: Then you will go on your way in safety, and your foot will not stumble.

24.text: When you lie down, you will not be afraid; when you rest, your sleep will be sweet.

25.text: Do not fear sudden danger or the ruin that overtakes the wicked,

26.text: for the LORD will be your confidence and will keep your foot from the snare.

27.text: Do not withhold good from the deserving when it is within your power to act.

28.text: Do not tell your neighbor, “Come back tomorrow and I will provide”—when you already have the means.

29.text: Do not devise evil against your neighbor, for he trustfully dwells beside you.

30.text: Do not accuse a man without cause, when he has done you no harm.

31.text: Do not envy a violent man or choose any of his ways;

32.text: for the LORD detests the perverse, but He is a friend to the upright.

33.text: The curse of the LORD is on the house of the wicked, but He blesses the home of the righteous.

34.text: He mocks the mockers, but gives grace to the humble.

35.text: The wise will inherit honor, but fools are held up to shame.
